definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
axis/axle/spool (for thread)/roller (for scrolls)/classifier for calligraphy rolls etc
see 壓軸戲|压轴戏[ya1 zhou4 xi4]/Taiwan pr. [zhou2]

sentences.english: He also collects rare ancient scrolls and sculptures.
sentences.chinese: 他的主要收藏包括罕见的古代画轴和雕塑。

sentences.english: Debbie purchased several kakemono scrolls during her year as an exchange student in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 德比在日本做交换学生时买了几卷画轴。

sentences.english: I can draw now any xy axis where I please, anywhere in the plane of the blackboard.
sentences.chinese: 可以在任意地方画轴，不管是黑板面任意点。

definition: (Taoism) talisman in the form of a painting of symbols thought to have magical powers
fine writing paper, originally from Jing county 涇縣|泾县, Xuancheng 宣城, Anhui
bamboo writing slips in ancient times (joined together to form whole scrolls)
